benchmark_details.name: Default Dataset
benchmark_details.overview: We introduce a new open dataset featuring financial transactions with credit default labels, enhancing the scope for practical research and development.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To explore effective attacks and defenses for models trained for classification tasks related to credit default in financial transactions.

data.source: The dataset is composed of anonymized financial transaction sequences with credit default labels.
data.annotation: Manual encoding of credit default target based on transaction sequences.

methods: Competitions for attack and defense strategies
methodology.calculation: Difference in ROC AUC values between model predictions for the original and adversarially altered transaction sequences.
methodology.interpretation: Higher ROC AUC indicates better model performance against adversarial attacks.
methodology.validation: Competition structure with different phases to assess model robustness through direct confrontations.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: User names are replaced with identification numbers, and transaction amounts are anonymized.
